name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A rich and hearty Italian meat sauce, perfect with spaghetti.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan. Add onion and cook until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Drain excess fat. Stir in garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Pour in red wine, bring to a simmer and cook until reduced by half.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and stock cube. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat, cover, and cook for at least 30 minutes (or longer for richer flavor), stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with cooked spaghetti.

name: Vegetable Stir-fry
description: Quick and healthy stir-fry with your favorite vegetables.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic.
Heat a large wok or pan over high heat. Add a little oil.
Add tofu (if using) and cook until golden, then remove.
Add harder vegetables (broccoli, carrots) and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add softer vegetables (bell pepper, snow peas) and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Return tofu to the pan. Pour in the sauce and toss to coat.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A classic Caesar salad with grilled chicken breast.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry until cooked through.
Let chicken rest, then slice into strips.
Wash and chop romaine lettuce. Place in a large bowl.
Add croutons, Parmesan cheese, and sliced chicken.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately.
